title: Introduction to Data Structures
content: Data structures are ways to store and organize data efficiently. Common types include arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs.
questions: Name 3 types of linear data structures.
What is the difference between stack and queue?

title: Arrays and Linked Lists
content: Arrays store elements at contiguous memory locations, while linked lists store elements at non-contiguous locations using nodes and pointers.
questions: How do you traverse an array?
What is a singly linked list?
Difference between array and linked list?
